mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Martha Washington to Elizabeth Powel, 1797 July 14
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Martha, 1731-1802
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Martha Washington writing from Mount Vernon states her objections to the French man mentioned by Mrs. Powel for job of supervising household servants at Mount Vernon -- saying that servants engaged in Philadelphia are too expensive, she affirms she must get one in Virginia -- mention Mrs. Hair -- the rumor of Nelly Custis's accident is groundless, and one of General's serious illness is based only on a slight cold he had in May -- laments Mr. Robert Morris's situation and confinement [he was imprisoned for debt] -- Mrs. Fitzhugh visited recently, and they are moving to Alexandria in October. Autograph letter signed, 4 pages, cover addressed by George Washington & franked by him, docketed by E. Powel "Received 18th July 1797," marked by hand "Alexa. 14 July" watermarks (crown over powder horn & LVG), excellent black seal with George Washington's coat of arms. Name on original manuscript appears as "M. Washington".
